name: Hotel Commonwealth

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth last weekend as a mini-getaway. I did tons of research on hotels, and I have to say we were thrilled with my final choice. Our room was big, with a separate sitting area with 2 very comfortable leather chairs, and a second TV. The bed was extremely comfortable with Frette linens. And the bathroom was large and so nicely decorated, with great L'Occitane products! We walked everywhere from the hotel....all the way to Long Wharf and back, but we are from NYC and used to walking. The T is right outside the front entrance of the hotel if you do not want to walk as much. Back Bay is about a 10-15 minute walk, and Fenway is right around the corner!
reviews.title: Loved the Commonwealth!

reviews.text: In all, we had a great weekend, and loved this hotel! We highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Great hotel near Fenway!

reviews.text: We recently returned from a mid-week night at this fantastic hotel. Our room was superb: extremely spacious, separate sitting area with additional tv, very comfortable king sized bed; overlooked Commonwealth Avenue. Ammenities such as robes, slippers, and turn down service made us feel very pampered. The staff was also very gracious and helpful.
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for New Year's Eve and could not have had a better experience. We were going to a concert at Agganis Arena and chose this hotel based on the location and reviews here. After taking the train in, we took the T to the Kenmore stop which is right at the hotel. Jeff welcomed us and immediately I felt like we chose the right spot. Carli greeted us at the desk and was awesome - we ended up upgrading to a suite and then were given 2 complimentary glasses of champagne to bring up. The room was great, overlooking Kenmore Square and the famous Citgo sign. We had made reservations at Island Creek Oyster Bar for dinner and it was so fabulous that we went again the next day for New Year's brunch. Bonus: It was freezing out and you can access the restaurants from inside, so it was nice not to deal with coats until later. From start to finish, everything was perfect. The bed was super comfortable and the rooms were very clean as well. I cannot thank everyone at the hotel enough for making it such a special night and I can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: Great start to the new year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Commonwealth Hotel welcomed us with champagne at the front desk and excellent service all around. The room was quite nice and had a separate sitting area overlooking Kenmore Square; the amenities and friendly staff made our stay even more pleasant. Island Creek and Eastern Standard are a winning combination of restaurants attached to the hotel and the T is right across the street. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Great location, amenities, facility and service. My new favorite place to stay in Boston. I've stayed at the Lenox, fairmont, Boston harbor and a few others,and the commonwealth is the best for my personal taste. If you want in your face first class service with serious sucking up, go to the Boston harbor... If you want simple unobtrusive comfort and luxury, the commonwealth is the place.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.text: We had a great stay here with our 2 kids. The rooms were spacious and clean and everyone at the hotel and restaurants was super-friendly and helpful. We loved Island Creek and Eastern Standard. Having 2 great restaurants in the lobby was a huge plus. Also, our son loved looking out at Fenway. It was very convenient to have the Kenmore T stop right below us. We didn't know much about the hotel coming in, but it was recommended by friends. Hotel Commonwealth far exceeded our expectations and we thought the price of 2 adjoining rms there was a good value - ask for AAA rate if you are a member.
reviews.title: Great family weekend in Boston at Hotel Commonwealth

reviews.text: We had a fantastic stay at the hotel. Service excellent. Nothing was too much to ask. Room spacecous and of a high standard. Excellent location right on the subway and every amenity in the same block. I can't fault our stay other than we could have stayed longer!
reviews.title: Highly recommended!!

reviews.text: I have been staying at this Hotel for over 1 1/2 years - it never fails to offer a great stay.
reviews.title: Great location, great service, great rooms!

reviews.text: Staff - especially doormen are very welcoming and helpful. Rooms are nicely appointed with lovely amenities.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We have had a lovely few days at the Hotel Commonwealth in Boston. Used tripadvisor to pick the place and we were definitely not disappointed. Having never been to Boston before, it is difficult to know where to stay, and we wanted a few days of luxury for a good price - after escaping university dorms in New York! The staff at the Commonwealth were lovely, and the Evening Standard restaurant was fantastic! The rooms are spacious and the beds very comfortable. I loved that there was a bath (with shower over the top) to relax after a long day site-seeing. The bathroom and bedroom decor is beautiful and we felt very pampered - a fantastic escape! The one downside was it is a fair way out of the main Newbury street and shopping area- directly opposite Fenway park (perfect if you are here for baseball), so be prepared to walk a fair way. But it is right next to the subway T station which is definitely convenient for getting out to Harvard or up to North end or other areas of the city. We walked everywhere, and despite the cold, it was nice to get some exercise! The management and concierge were extremely welcoming and helpful - giving us tips for transport, dining and tourism activities around Boston. They also provided a coffee/tea maker machine complimentary on request. Free wifi is definitely a bonus to help keep in touch, and look up sites and tourist options around town. I would definitely recommend this hotel again and look forward to returning for another Boston escape! Thank you:)
reviews.title: Quiet in Boston

reviews.text: Stayed at the Commonwealth Hotel on a cold, January night. The hotel however was warm and inviting with friendly staff and a wonderful location just at the Kendall Square Tube, but also just a 10 minute walk to the Prudential Center, Newbury Street Shopping, etc. It's just around the corner from Fenway Park and a 15 minute walk to the MFA so we never even took the T.
reviews.title: Nice, friendly, comfortable and quiet

reviews.text: Room was spacious, clean and comfortable, included a choice of complimentary morning newspaper delivered to your door. Only complaint would be that parking is expensive $42 and if you're staying beyond 2 pm on the day you check out it's another $18, even if you're only staying an hour or two. Still would definitely recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Stay At Commonwealth!

reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Commonwealth for 4 nights in late November 2012 and were very well looked after. There is an air of peace, comfort and order at this hotel that makes it a great place to come back to after a day out and about Boston. We loved the free shoe shine, especially when my favourite boots came back looking spanking new! Also loved the Island Creek Oyster Bar where we dined twice...just couldn't get enough of those freshly shucked little neck clams. YUM!
reviews.title: Quiet, comfy retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks, folks, for running a top hotel!
reviews.title: Awesome Stay at Hotel Commonwealth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say enough about our stay at the Hotel Commonwealth (2 couples for four days -- 12/29/12 - 1/1/13. We had a luxury suite with an adjoining jr. suite. Both were clean and immaculate. What made our stay really special was the attentiveness of the staff. Whatever we needed was attended to quickly and with perfection. They exceeded all of our expectations. Great location on Kenmore Square. Walking distance to Fenway, the House of Blues and great restaurants. The Hotel Commonwealth has its own driver. Lew is his name, so ask if he is available. We ended up using him to drive us to various locations throughout our stay when he wasn't otherwise obligated. He was great and riding in his Escalade was better than stuffing ourselves into a cab. The concierge at the hotel was very helpful. Definitely try out the Eastern Standard Restaurant and the Island Creek Oyster Bar, which are connected to the Hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, great service- Hotel Commonwealth in Boston's Back Bay!

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I visited Boston for New Years Eve 2013 and had a very enjoyable stay at Hotel Commonwealth. The hotel's location is excellent for those who want to visit Fenway Park, Copley Square and Newberry Street. Even in the cold winter months, it is easy to walk to all these great attractions from the hotel. The hotel has two fantastic restaurants and the service in the restaurants and the hotel is impeccable. The rooms are very generously sized and the staff is very knowledgeble and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel for those interested in taking in all the historic (Boston Tea Party Museum, Copley Square, Fenway Park) and non-historic (Samuel Adams Brewery) highlights of Boston for a weekend (as we did) or week!
reviews.title: Terrific Boston Hotel!

reviews.text: We had a great weekend in Boston staying at the Hotel Commonwealth. The staff is extremely courteous and accommodating, meeting all of our needs. The room was beautiful. It was roomy and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Hotel commonwealth

reviews.text: Three generations of our expanding family gathered at the Commonwealth for a pre Christmas weekend stay and reception. The Commonwealth rose to the occasion and knocked every ball well out of Fenway. Room amenities, food quality, and service far exceeded expectations, while the events staff played its orchestration role with with stylish creativity and uncanny anticipation. And who can argue with the location.
reviews.title: Quality and Solid Value Top to Bottom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I kept thinking that Management must devote great care to the selection and training of all staff and of little things which differentiate a great hotel stay from an average. Waitstaff, doormen, desk personnel were knowledgeable about their areas of responsibility, from the provenance of the various oysters on offer to the history of the building and the neighborhood. Our family felt that the staff proudly projected its sense of pride and place. This creates an atmosphere which one can't simply buy. This added to the geniuineness of our experience and we left as we had stayed, in comfort and hoping to repeat the experience.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Boston

reviews.text: This is a welcoming hotel where you will be looked after very well. It's in a great location with a lively restaurant / bar -- Eastern Standard. The room we had was spacious and comfortable. We would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Best place to staynin Boston!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Awesome boutique hotel. Location near transportation, restaurants and Fenway Park is unbeatable. Staff extremely helpful and accommodating. Rooms are immaculate and comfortable. Much more reasonably priced than other hotels in the city.
reviews.title: expected a good experience; got a superior one!

reviews.text: The Hotel Commonwealth exceeded my expectations. We booked a basic room with a king bed (Kenmore Sq side), but once we informed them we were celebrating an anniversary and birthday, we were upgraded to a junior suite (Kenmore Sq side). It was a lovely, spacious and luxurious room. Further, after dining at Eastern Standard for Christmas dinner - another great experience - we came back to a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine and chocolates. While it is likely that the hotel had empty rooms due to the holiday, they surely did not need to make the upgrade or surprise us with a celebratory bottle. The room was clean, quiet and outfitted with upscale sheets, bath linens and robe. A terrific experience all around. We have stayed at other top hotels in the city, but the Hotel Commonwealth will now be our 1st choice.
reviews.title: Top rated hotel and service

reviews.text: Me and my better-half stayed here last week and had a very enjoyable stay. It really is a nice place, nice decor, very clean, nice staff, lovely room, great bathroom- we liked everything about it.
reviews.title: Really very very nice

reviews.text: The only Baseball game I ever saw before was in Detroit and i've never been so bored- strangely enough on our first night Detroit played at Fenway- needless to say I gave it a miss. And the Stones played on our last night- we went for a walk- Charlie's drumming was a bit too much. But I loved it all really. We recommend stolling into town down cosmopolitan Newbury St, and like us you may not even make it into the city.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Commonwealth for 3nights at the end of 2 week holiday. Hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was large and well appointed, the air conditioning quiet and efficient. The highlight has to be the beds probably the most comfortable hotel bed with absolutely superb bed linen and pillows. The staff were welcoming and very helpful. Location is slightly out of the way but with a station to downtown underneath and a 5 minute walk to Back Bay not a major issue. Only downside is the lack of a decent diner for breakfast close to the hotel. Hotel breakfast very good but pricey when feding 4. highly recommend this hotel and would stay here next time i am in Boston.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - shame about the building site

reviews.text: This was a lovely hotel with comfortable clean rooms (my wife wanted to take the bed home!), friendly helpful staff and still reasonable prices. Decor was tasteful and the service, old fashioned courtesy. Eastern Standard (the restaurant attached to the hotel) had a good selection of affordable meals, with other oulets nearby.
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel

reviews.text: The location isnt ideal being slightly away from the Centre of Boston and facing the "Big Dig". But if you are a baseball fan, the proximity of Fenmore would be an advantage.
reviews.title: Loved It
Not four stars
reviews.text: A decent hotel but definitely not Four Seasons quality or service level, which I think is what they are trying to reach. The hotel walls must be very thin, because I heard the ice machine every night, as well as the rather loud guests heading to the elevator at midnight. We had requested a crib for our room and the one we got was unstable and it took more than two hours for staff to find a sheet that fit it. The one they eventually found had to be held together with safety pins!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were competent but not particularly welcoming. Turndown service was also a bit random--we got cookies one night but nothing the other three nights we were there.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, delicious breakfast

reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed the evening we got engaged (we're Mass residents). The hotel staff was extremely pleasant from the moment we handed the keys over to the valet to when we checked out. We stayed in a suite. One side of the room- closest to the windows- had a nicely furnished, comfortable, and spacious sitting area with a TV. A curtain could be pulled to separate the seating area from the area with the bed and bath, which came in handy since I woke up earlier and wanted to watch some TV and read.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived in our room, champagne, fine chocolates, and a note were waiting for us (not something my fiance requested - just a gesture from the hotel). The handwritten card congratulated us and thanked us for choosing the Hotel Commonwealth to spend our special evening at. What a thoughtful touch. We're just two kids in our early twenties, not staying in the most expensive room, so the gesture was that much more appreciated. Sometimes I feel snubbed by hotel staff, like my money isn't as valuable because I'm younger. Not so at this hotel.
reviews.title: Comm. Ave. is a work in progress...

reviews.text: The bathroom in our suite had a separate toilet area from the shower/sink area. The tub shower was large with beautiful marble. The bedding was very soft and comfortable, with plenty of pillows. It was like sleeping on a cloud.
reviews.title: location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Commonwealth during the first week of December and had a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Great Time At The Commonwealth

reviews.text: We booked a Commonwealth room which was spacious and comfortable and looked out on to Commonwealth Avenue. We didn't want to stay right in the city centre so this hotel was ideal as it was only 2 stops on the T or a $6 cab ride in to the main shopping area. We only ate bvreakfast at the hotel so can't really comment on the dining but what we had was excellent. The staff were always courteous and helpful and it was handy to have heaters while waiting for the doorman to get us a cab!
reviews.title: Much better than similarly priced hotels
Fantastic
reviews.text: I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Boston.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My colleague and I stayed here while attending an annual conference in Boston. We had always stayed at the Hyatt prior to this, but we had decided to try this hotel on a whim. We now wished we had known about the Hotel Commonwealth years ago. I cring when I think about all those wasted over-priced stays at the Hyatt. The Commonwealth far outshines its competitors in terms of the quality of the rooms and of the service. Our room was absolutely beautiful and had a view over Fenway park. We raved about this hotel to all our friends at the conference and plan to stay here every year now.
reviews.title: Nice but noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here twice (New Years and March) and couldn't be happier with their service and the accomodations. I did their package where you can prepare lunch with the Chef at Eastern Standard and I must say it was one of the best experiences of my life. (And best birthday celebrations) I recomend this for anyone looking for a relaxing break from the city even if you live here or are visiting.
reviews.title: most comforatable hotel bed ever!

reviews.text: I had a very pleasant stay here. The hotel was very clean and comfortable (gives you an impression that it is a very new hotel). The staff were very friendly. They offer free internet in rooms, mine did not work (probablty due to my laptop), but the on-site technician did his best to make it work. They actually knock the doors at night and give cookies and chocolate :)) I would certainly stay here again
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel
Never stay at Hotel Commonwealth!!!!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth one night. When I left in the morning I forgot my jewelry on the night table. I called back to see if they could get it for me. Apparently the maid had already cleaned the room and guess what... they couldn't find my jewelry. I was dumb-founded by the way they handle it. The maid claimed that we had left our door ajar. Hmmmm... Basically they told me that I should have locked up my jewelry in the future and that was that. I advise no one to stay at this hotel, apparently the customer is never right.
No complaints about this hotel, but if you're looking for charm, style, uniqueness...you can probably do better in Boston.
reviews.title: Pseudo Elegance -- But Quite Comfortable
Just OK
reviews.text: We booked one of the larger rooms facing Commonwealth St (the most expensive room, which I believed is called a "commonwealth" room). This room is great if you're traveling with a child or third friend, as it has a large office space with sleeper couch than can be divided from main bed with a curtain.
The good: very quiet and comfortable, outstanding bed and pillows (slept wonderfully), modern comfort, clean, marble bathroom, toilet in separate room from shower, L'Occitaine bath products.
reviews.title: Good sized rooms, comfortable beds, great hotel

reviews.text: I am a Boston University alum and on a whim and after not being able to get Red Sox tickets in Atlanta, my husband and I decided to take an impromptu trip to Beantown. I had heard about Hotel Commonwealth and knew the location would be perfect to show my husband all my old haunts. Imagine my surprise when we found a great rate for oneof their smaller rooms! I immediately booked and could not wait to arrive at my first luxury hotel, as we normally stay at middle of the road places when we travel. (Doubletree, Sheraton, etc.)
reviews.title: Best hotel EVAH!

reviews.text: The outside of the hotel is beautiful and really spruces up Kenmore Square, for anyone that was a BU student from 92 -96, HC is where the IHOP use to be. They renovated the Kenmore Square T exit so when you come above ground the hotel is directly to the right. Through the double doors(with doorman) and you walk into top notch luxury. Plush carpeting, fantastic decor. At the counter we were greeted quickly and efficiently by a lovely woman with an accent. If it had been my first time to Boston I felt confident the front desk staff would be helpful in everyway possible.
reviews.title: Great room- great location!

reviews.text: Our room was on the 3rd floor and when we got off the elevator, the window in the foyer gave a wicked awesome view of the Green Monster and Fenway. My husband was stoked, as this was his first live view of Fenway. We got to the room and I was amazed. Granted this was one of their smaller rooms, but it was gorgeous and definitely big enough for two. There were two closets, one housing a safe. A desk, armoire with TV and stocked minifridge. I felt like royalty! The bed was soft and had a ton of pillows. The bathroom had beautiful tile and L'Occitane toiletries. Every felt so grand I almost didn't want to leave the room!!
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: Overall I will suggest this hotel over and over for anyone visiting Boston for the first or 50th time. The prices are right on with comparable high end hotels. The location is excellent and the service and atmosphere can't be beat!!
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.text: My boyfriend booked us a room here for my birthday and we were very pleased with our stay. The staff was very friendly and personable; they even joked around with us as we were checking in. The room was clean and spacious. I am a huge Red Sox fan so the view of Fenway Park from our room was spectacular! The hotel is in a great location with inside access to two restaurants, Eastern Standard and Great Bay. I had eaten in Eastern Standard before our stay and recommend it to everyone- service is impeccable, food is fantastic and the price is just right. We ate at Great Bay the night of our stay- service was exceptional but we were not impressed with the food for the price. Within walking distance to Fenway Park, lots of nightclubs, and the Green Line to take downtown. I am a travel agent with high standards and would stay in the Hotel Commonwealth again and again.
reviews.title: Liked it better than the Ritz!

reviews.text: My wife and I decided to take a weekend getaway up the road in Boston. In looking for a hotel, I wanted something nice, but not terribly expensive. I thought the rate for the Hotel Commonwealth (about $ 199 per night) seemed a little steep-- but not really for Boston where a night at a first class hotel like the Ritz or the Four Seasons can run up to $ 400. Plus, the Commonwealth is right next door to one of our favorite Boston restaurants (Petite Robert Bistro), with lots of bookstores in the area, so we decided to give it a try.
reviews.title: A real winner in Kenmore Square
Absolutely Loved this hotel!
reviews.text: We were not disapppointed. And the nightly rate was well worth it for the excellent service and marvelous accomodations we enjoyed. This is an exceedingly well run hotel; everyone from the front desk staff to the bellhops to the parking attendants seem intent on doing their jobs to their full ability. They were extremely friendly and efficient, and made us feel pampered and welcome indeed!

The hotel is only about two years old, so the facilities are in excellent condition-- and everything is spotless. Our room was HUGE-- twice as large as some comparable places we've stayed. Amenities and facilities are excellent. Our only complaint was a slight problem we had with regulating the temperature: hot one moment, cold the next, but eventually we got it all right.
reviews.title: Beyond my Expectations!

reviews.text: Do yourself a favor next time you're in Boston and stay at the Hotel Commonwealth.
reviews.title: The Positives Win

reviews.text: Our friends stayed there previously and my wife and I had read about the hotel in T+L and in-flight magazines when we travel, so we thought we'd give it a shot. We were amazed at the service, the L'Occitane products, and how big the rooms were. We had a parlor room called the Commonwealth room and it was all we had wished for: two tvs, drapes that pull and split the room in two and so much more. We will recommend to everyone we know when they travel to Boston.
reviews.title: Super Clean!!
Great hotel for family trip!
reviews.text: Our family stayed here 2 nights in September based on a positive review in the New York Times. We reserved a Junior Suite. It was a clean, gorgeous and spacious room overlooking Fenway Park. Hotel is steps away from Kenmore Square T station. It was a very nice, safe hotel in the middle of the city. Large bathrooms, solid housekeeping. We will definitely return!

reviews.title: Eh
reviews.text: Alright hotel - too expensive and lacks character.

reviews.title: Charming, spacious, wonderful
reviews.text: Also, in a dissapointing location. Kenmore Square is not what I would consider an ideal location. No, you could not stay at a better place so close to Fenway Park, but Boston has more to offer than just the baseball. I used the subway on a regular basis to bring me towards downtown area. Next time I will stay somewhere closer to the action so I can walk more and take public transit less.
After reading many many reviews on the hotels listed for Boston, I booked the Commonwealth.
reviews.title: some niggles - maybe not worth the price

reviews.text: Although it is outside the hustle and bustle, Hotel Commonwealth is a perfect location for a couple. My partner was there on business so I had the day to myself. After packing light for the overnight stay I realized after a few hours of wandering that my bag was just too heavy.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Commonwealth
Excellent!
reviews.text: Stayed here recently for 3 nights. Hotel is only a few years old and therefore still has that "new" feeling. Located across the street from Fenway and I have a perfect view of the park from my room. Front desk staff were ok but not real friendly. Bell hop and our "driver" were much more customer oriented. Lew, our bellman delivered ice, got movies, you name it. He was sweet and more than helpful and after our first tip to him, he actually refused the others!!! Hotel has a car (Mercedes) and they offered to drive us to a restaurant, the trolley stop, and the airport. We had the same driver each time (a college boy) and he was very nice and helpful. I suspect that service will be discontinued when demand for it gets to high. Room was large, bed was comfortable, bathroom was very nice. We couldn't get two double beds all during our stay and my college age daughter had to sleep on a sleeper sofa. They have a movie DVD list. Movies are delivered to your door, and are free. They even come in a gift bag with popped popcorn! I paid about $260 per night. Only 2 negatives: the dinner we ordered at Eastern Standard was not good at all - a total ripoff. And the cleaning staff did not throw out our leftover chinese food when the cleaned the room so it smelled the next day and I had to track down someone to throw it out for us. High speed internet was free. But BEWARE, I made three one minute long distance calls to my daughter's cell phone while she was out sightseeing in Boston. They cost me $30!!!! You read that right - thirty dollars!!!!!!!!! The front desk refused to remove the charge saying it was the charge of a contract company and they could not touch it. Other than that I totally enjoyed my stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I brought my husband here for his birthday so we could spend a romantic night away from home. I picked this hotel because it had rooms with views of fenway park. My husband loved it. We walked down to the park and checked out the shops. We thoroughly enjoyed the wonderful breakfast we shared in our room. The only thing that would have made this stay the best, tickets to a game!
reviews.title: luxury with a fenway view

reviews.text: The jackhammering started promptly at 1:30 AM, directly outside our window. The hotel hadn't warned us, they weren't able to tell us when it would end, and they didn't know if it would happen again the next night. We were eventually moved to another room. The hotel was not able to provide a comparable room because all of the large rooms are on the construction side.
reviews.title: Jackhammers, 2AM

reviews.text: The Commonwealth faces onto Kenmore Square where a subway station is being renovated. Apparently (I later discovered), the work is done between 1:30 and 4 AM when the subway isn't operating.
reviews.title: Pretty Good... a couple minor problems

reviews.text: I indicated that I was leaving ahead of schedule and that I expected a discount for the sleepless night. The manager refused to grant a discount. The front desk clerk added that they had "tried to accomodate" me and that they were waiving the penalty they normally charge when a guest leaves before the end of their reservation.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend the Hotel Commonwealth!

description: Discover Hotel Commonwealth, a luxury Boston boutique hotel offering elegance and style in downtown Boston Massachusetts. The grand cornerstone of Boston’s Kenmore Square, Hotel Commonwealth features gracious hospitality with classic style. Just steps away from world class medical institutions, the Back Bay, Red Sox games at Fenway Park, and Boston’s many cultural and historical attractions, luxurious Hotel Commonwealth is a relaxing and elegant oasis for an urban adventure or business gathering.
